headline: AI Chips Update - Navitas Expands Global Reach With Avnet Partnership
summary: Navitas Semiconductor has broadened its global distribution network through an expanded partnership with Avnet, a leading electronic component distributor. This extended collaboration, building on an existing relationship with Avnet Silica in Europe, positions Avnet as a globally franchised partner to support markets experiencing rapid growth, such as AI data centers, high-performance computing, and industrial electrification. By consolidating its distribution network, Navitas aims to provide...

headline: Jobs Data, Inflation Reports, Nike Earnings: Coming Next Week
summary: The last full trading week before Christmas could be a busy one. Key economic data that was delayed by the shutdown is due, including the jobs report and the consumer-price index for November. A series of Federal Reserve policymakers are due to speak, days after the central bank's latest rate cut, and a reasonably busy earnings calendar includes earnings from Nike, FedEx and Micron.

headline: Oracle pushes back several data centers for OpenAI to 2028, Bloomberg News reports
summary: Oracle has pushed back the completion dates for some of ​the data centers it is developing ‌for OpenAI to 2028 from 2027, Bloomberg News reported ‌on Friday citing people familiar with the work.  The delays ‌are largely due to labor and material shortages, according to the Bloomberg report.  Oracle's shares have been ​falling since its earnings report ​on Wednesday, sparking a tech selloff on Thursday.

content.title: Oracle pushes back several data centers for OpenAI to 2028, Bloomberg News reports
content.summary: Oracle has pushed back the completion dates for some of ​the data centers it is developing ‌for OpenAI to 2028 from 2027, Bloomberg News reported ‌on Friday citing people familiar with the work.  The delays ‌are largely due to labor and material shortages, according to the Bloomberg report.  Oracle's shares have been ​falling since its earnings report ​on Wednesday, sparking a tech selloff on Thursday.
